high_relevance.description: Learning occurs through increasing participation in communities of practice, moving from peripheral to full participation
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: Directly addresses the novice-to-core developer transition pathway, which AI may fundamentally alter
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model AI as changing the 'periphery' definition and creating new participation trajectories
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Theorizing how AI redefines legitimate participation pathways in OSS communities

high_relevance.description: Individuals are motivated by developing competence and receiving positive feedback on their capabilities
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: AI may change how developers build and demonstrate competence, affecting motivation and career progression
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model competence development as a stock affected by AI tools and feedback mechanisms
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Understanding how AI alters competence signaling and motivation in OSS career paths

high_relevance.description: Organization's ability to recognize, assimilate, and apply new external knowledge
high_relevance.relevance_to_rqs: AI changes how developers absorb project knowledge and community practices
high_relevance.relevance_to_model: Model knowledge absorption rates and thresholds affected by AI tools
high_relevance.phd_contribution: Theorizing how AI transforms individual and collective absorptive capacity in OSS

adjacent_opportunities.description: Artifacts that enable coordination across different social worlds while maintaining separate meanings
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Focuses on artifacts rather than people, but AI-generated code/documentation could become new boundary objects
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: AI outputs as boundary objects that reshape community interactions and knowledge transfer
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Understanding AI artifacts as coordination mechanisms in OSS career progression

adjacent_opportunities.description: Cognitive processes are distributed across individuals, artifacts, and environments
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Shifts focus from individual learning to system-level cognition that AI transforms
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: AI as a cognitive partner redistributing thinking and learning across the OSS ecosystem
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Modeling how AI redistributes cognitive labor in OSS career development

adjacent_opportunities.description: Career development through self-efficacy, outcome expectations, and personal goals
adjacent_opportunities.why_adjacent: Individual-focused rather than community-focused, but AI may reshape career self-perceptions
adjacent_opportunities.novel_angle: How AI tools affect developers' self-efficacy and career expectations in OSS
adjacent_opportunities.phd_contribution: Understanding AI's impact on career self-concept and decision-making in OSS

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Community structure changes over time as species replace one another in a habitat
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Model OSS career paths as ecological succession with AI as environmental disturbance
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides powerful metaphors for understanding how AI disrupts established career succession patterns

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Human and non-human actors form networks that shape social structures
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Treat AI systems as actors in OSS career networks with agency and influence
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Radically reframes AI from tool to participant, enabling novel insights about career pathways

cross_domain_inspiration.parallel: Technological change alters relative demand for different skill types
cross_domain_inspiration.transfer_potential: Model how AI changes the skill composition and valuation in OSS career ladders
cross_domain_inspiration.rationale: Provides economic framing for understanding how AI reshapes the OSS labor market and career incentives
